Comment: A Hello World example demonstrating various state types of the Amazon States Language

Pass.Comment: A Pass state passes its input to its output, without performing work. Pass states are useful when constructing and debugging state machines.

Hello World example?.Comment: A Choice state adds branching logic to a state machine. Choice rules can implement 16 different comparison operators, and can be combined using And, Or, and Not

Wait 1 sec.Comment: A Wait state delays the state machine from continuing for a specified time.

Parallel State.Comment: A Parallel state can be used to create parallel branches of execution in your state machine.
